result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jina Marie Savaglio was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jina Marie Savaglio was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Jina Marie Savaglio in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. On count 1, Court imposed 22 days jail commencing July 14, 2017 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules, includes treatment. $1,505 fine. $87 blood draw fee. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 15 month revocation, 15 month IID. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. On count 3, $243 costs. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. Jail credit to be determined. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed.
